page.title: 15FROM SHIPS TO OIL RIGS
page.content: From its origins as a fishing village called Newark, Port Glasgow developed as the port of Glasgow and became a major shipbuilding centre in 19th and 20th centuries. The decision by British Shipbuilders to switch production at {Scott Lithgow} from ships to semi-submersible oil platforms resulted in near tragedy. Trafalgar House, the new private owner of the Scott Lithgow Group has also laid off men. Despite tremendous efforts by unions, District Council, churches and the communities of Port Glasgow and Greenock the future remains shrouded in uncertaintity.This obviously has a demoralising effect on the many skilled workers who remain unemployed. It also means that many talented, energetic young people may have to leave the district to seek their fortunes elsewhere
